1→/-
     2→Copyright (c) 2020 Bhavik Mehta. All rights reserved.
     3→Released under Apache 2.0 license as described in the file LICENSE.
     4→Authors: Bhavik Mehta
     5→-/
     6→import Mathlib.Algebra.Order.Group.Nat
     7→import Mathlib.Data.Finset.Max
     8→import Mathlib.Data.Fintype.Powerset
     9→import Mathlib.Data.Set.Monotone
    10→import Mathlib.Order.Interval.Finset.Nat
    11→
    12→/-!
    13→# Erdős–Szekeres theorem
    14→
    15→This file proves Theorem 73 from the [100 Theorems List](https://www.cs.ru.nl/~freek/100/), also
    16→known as the Erdős–Szekeres theorem: given a sequence of more than `r * s` distinct
    17→values, there is an increasing sequence of length longer than `r` or a decreasing sequence of length
    18→longer than `s`.
    19→
    20→We use the proof outlined at
    21→https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Erdos-Szekeres_theorem#Pigeonhole_principle.
    22→
    23→## Tags
    24→
    25→sequences, increasing, decreasing, Ramsey, Erdos-Szekeres, Erdős–Szekeres, Erdős-Szekeres
    26→-/
    27→
    28→open Function Finset
    29→
    30→namespace Theorems100
    31→
    32→variable {α β : Type*} [Fintype α] [LinearOrder α] [LinearOrder β] {f : α → β} {i : α}
    33→
    34→/-- The possible lengths of an increasing sequence which ends at `i`. -/
    35→private noncomputable def incSequencesTo (f : α → β) (i : α) : Finset ℕ :=
    36→  open Classical in
    37→  image card {t : Finset α | IsGreatest t i ∧ StrictMonoOn f t}
    38→
    39→/-- The possible lengths of a decreasing sequence which ends at `i`. -/
    40→private noncomputable def decSequencesTo (f : α → β) (i : α) : Finset ℕ :=
    41→  open Classical in
    42→  image card {t : Finset α | IsGreatest t i ∧ StrictAntiOn f t}
    43→
    44→/-- The singleton sequence is increasing, so 1 is a possible length. -/
    45→private lemma one_mem_incSequencesTo : 1 ∈ incSequencesTo f i := mem_image.2 ⟨{i}, by simp⟩
    46→/-- The singleton sequence is decreasing, so 1 is a possible length. -/
    47→private lemma one_mem_decSequencesTo : 1 ∈ decSequencesTo f i := one_mem_incSequencesTo (β := βᵒᵈ)
    48→
    49→/-- The singleton sequence is increasing, so the set of lengths is nonempty. -/
    50→private lemma incSequencesTo_nonempty : (incSequencesTo f i).Nonempty := ⟨1, one_mem_incSequencesTo⟩
    51→/-- The singleton sequence is decreasing, so the set of lengths is nonempty. -/
    52→private lemma decSequencesTo_nonempty : (decSequencesTo f i).Nonempty := ⟨1, one_mem_decSequencesTo⟩
    53→
    54→/-- The maximum length of an increasing sequence which ends at `i`. -/
    55→private noncomputable def maxIncSequencesTo (f : α → β) (i : α) : ℕ :=
    56→  max' (incSequencesTo f i) incSequencesTo_nonempty
    57→
    58→/-- The maximum length of a decreasing sequence which ends at `i`. -/
    59→private noncomputable def maxDecSequencesTo (f : α → β) (i : α) : ℕ :=
    60→  max' (decSequencesTo f i) decSequencesTo_nonempty
    61→
    62→private lemma one_le_maxIncSequencesTo : 1 ≤ maxIncSequencesTo f i :=
    63→  le_max' _ _ one_mem_incSequencesTo
    64→private lemma one_le_maxDecSequencesTo : 1 ≤ maxDecSequencesTo f i :=
    65→  le_max' _ _ one_mem_decSequencesTo
    66→
    67→private lemma maxIncSequencesTo_mem : maxIncSequencesTo f i ∈ incSequencesTo f i :=
    68→  max'_mem _ incSequencesTo_nonempty
    69→private lemma maxDecSequencesTo_mem : maxDecSequencesTo f i ∈ decSequencesTo f i :=
    70→  max'_mem _ decSequencesTo_nonempty
    71→
    72→/--
    73→We will want to show that if `i ≠ j`, then the pairs
    74→`(maxIncSequencesTo f i, maxDecSequencesTo f i)` and
    75→`(maxIncSequencesTo f j, maxDecSequencesTo f j)` are different.
    76→To this end, we will assume wlog that `i < j`, and show that if `f i < f j`,
    77→then `maxIncSequencesTo f i < maxIncSequencesTo f j`, and later dualise to prove that if `f j < f i`
    78→then `maxDecSequencesTo f i < maxDecSequencesTo f j`.
    79→-/
    80→private lemma maxIncSequencesTo_lt {i j : α} (hij : i < j) (hfij : f i < f j) :
    81→    maxIncSequencesTo f i < maxIncSequencesTo f j := by
    82→  classical
    83→  rw [Nat.lt_iff_add_one_le]
    84→  refine le_max' _ _ ?_
    85→  have : maxIncSequencesTo f i ∈ incSequencesTo f i := max'_mem _ incSequencesTo_nonempty
    86→  simp only [incSequencesTo, mem_image, mem_filter, mem_univ, true_and, and_assoc] at this
    87→  obtain ⟨t, hti, ht₁, ht₂⟩ := this
    88→  simp only [incSequencesTo, mem_image, mem_filter, mem_univ, true_and, and_assoc]
    89→  have : ∀ x ∈ t, x < j := by
    90→    intro x hx
    91→    exact (hti.2 hx).trans_lt hij
    92→  refine ⟨insert j t, ?_, ?_, ?_⟩
    93→  next =>
    94→    convert hti.insert j using 1
    95→    next => simp
    96→    next => rw [max_eq_left hij.le]
    97→  next =>
    98→    simp only [coe_insert]
    99→    rw [strictMonoOn_insert_iff_of_forall_le]
   100→    · refine ⟨?_, ht₁⟩
   101→      intro x hx hxj
   102→      exact (ht₁.monotoneOn hx hti.1 (hti.2 hx)).trans_lt hfij
   103→    · exact fun x hx ↦ (this x hx).le
   104→  have : j ∉ t := fun hj ↦ lt_irrefl _ (this _ hj)
   105→  simp [this, ht₂]
   106→
   107→private lemma maxDecSequencesTo_gt {i j : α} (hij : i < j) (hfij : f j < f i) :
   108→    maxDecSequencesTo f i < maxDecSequencesTo f j :=
   109→  maxIncSequencesTo_lt (β := βᵒᵈ) hij hfij
   110→
   111→/--
   112→For each entry, we form a pair of labels consisting of the maximum lengths of increasing and
   113→decreasing sequences ending there.
   114→-/
   115→private noncomputable def paired (f : α → β) (i : α) : ℕ × ℕ :=
   116→  (maxIncSequencesTo f i, maxDecSequencesTo f i)
   117→
   118→/--
   119→By combining the previous two lemmas, we see that since `f` is injective, the pairs of labels
   120→must also be unique.
   121→-/
   122→private lemma paired_injective (hf : Injective f) : Injective (paired f) := by
   123→  apply Injective.of_lt_imp_ne
   124→  intro i j hij q
   125→  cases lt_or_gt_of_ne (hf.ne hij.ne)
   126→  case inl h => exact (maxIncSequencesTo_lt hij h).ne congr($q.1)
   127→  case inr h => exact (maxDecSequencesTo_gt hij h).ne congr($q.2)
   128→
   129→/-- **Erdős–Szekeres Theorem**: Given a sequence of more than `r * s` distinct values, there is an
   130→increasing sequence of length longer than `r` or a decreasing sequence of length longer than `s`.
   131→
   132→Proof idea:
   133→We label each value in the sequence with two numbers specifying the longest increasing
   134→subsequence ending there, and the longest decreasing subsequence ending there.
   135→We then show the pair of labels must be unique. Now if there is no increasing sequence longer than
   136→`r` and no decreasing sequence longer than `s`, then there are at most `r * s` possible labels,
   137→which is a contradiction if there are more than `r * s` elements.
   138→-/
   139→theorem erdos_szekeres {r s : ℕ} {f : α → β} (hn : r * s < Fintype.card α) (hf : Injective f) :
   140→    (∃ t : Finset α, r < #t ∧ StrictMonoOn f t) ∨
   141→      ∃ t : Finset α, s < #t ∧ StrictAntiOn f t := by
   142→  classical
   143→  -- It suffices to prove that there is some `i` where one of the max lengths is bigger than
   144→  -- `r` or `s`, as this corresponds to a monotone sequence of the required length.
   145→  rsuffices ⟨i, hi⟩ : ∃ i, r < maxIncSequencesTo f i ∨ s < maxDecSequencesTo f i
   146→  · refine Or.imp ?_ ?_ hi
   147→    on_goal 1 =>
   148→      have : maxIncSequencesTo f i ∈ image card _ := maxIncSequencesTo_mem
   149→    on_goal 2 =>
   150→      have : maxDecSequencesTo f i ∈ image card _ := maxDecSequencesTo_mem
   151→    all_goals
   152→      intro hi
   153→      obtain ⟨t, ht₁, ht₂⟩ := mem_image.1 this
   154→      refine ⟨t, by rwa [ht₂], ?_⟩
   155→      rw [mem_filter] at ht₁
   156→      exact ht₁.2.2
   157→  -- If such an `i` does not exist, then our pairs of labels lie in a small set, which is a
   158→  -- contradiction since the pairs are unique.
   159→  by_contra! q
   160→  have : Set.MapsTo (paired f) (univ : Finset α) (Icc 1 r ×ˢ Icc 1 s : Finset _) := by
   161→    simp [paired, one_le_maxIncSequencesTo, one_le_maxDecSequencesTo, Set.MapsTo, *]
   162→  refine hn.not_ge ?_
   163→  simpa using card_le_card_of_injOn (paired f) this (paired_injective hf).injOn
   164→
   165→end Theorems100
   166→

content.text: Excellent! Now let me look at a few of these conjecture files to see how they define Ramsey numbers, and check if there's a more unified definition in Mathlib:

content.content:
1→import Mathlib.Combinatorics.SimpleGraph.Basic
     2→import Mathlib.Combinatorics.SimpleGraph.Clique
     3→import Mathlib.Data.Nat.Lattice
     4→import Mathlib.Data.Real.Basic
     5→
     6→open SimpleGraph
     7→
     8→noncomputable section
     9→
    10→/-!
    11→# Erdős Problem #1014
    12→
    13→Let R(k,l) be the Ramsey number, so the minimal n such that every graph on at
    14→least n vertices contains either a K_k or an independent set on l vertices.
    15→
    16→Prove, for fixed k ≥ 3, that
    17→  lim_{l → ∞} R(k, l+1) / R(k, l) = 1.
    18→
    19→This is open even for k = 3.
    20→
    21→Tags: graph theory, ramsey theory
    22→-/
    23→
    24→/-- The Ramsey number R(k, l): the minimum N such that every simple graph on N
    25→    vertices contains either a k-clique or an independent set of size l
    26→    (equivalently, an l-clique in the complement). -/
    27→noncomputable def ramseyR (k l : ℕ) : ℕ :=
    28→  sInf {N : ℕ | ∀ (G : SimpleGraph (Fin N)), ¬G.CliqueFree k ∨ ¬Gᶜ.CliqueFree l}
    29→
    30→/--
    31→Erdős Problem #1014 [Er71, p.99]:
    32→
    33→For fixed k ≥ 3, lim_{l → ∞} R(k, l+1) / R(k, l) = 1,
    34→
    35→where R(k, l) is the Ramsey number.
    36→
    37→Formulated as: for every ε > 0, there exists L₀ such that for all l ≥ L₀,
    38→  |R(k, l+1) / R(k, l) - 1| ≤ ε.
    39→-/
    40→theorem erdos_problem_1014 (k : ℕ) (hk : k ≥ 3) :
    41→    ∀ ε : ℝ, ε > 0 →
    42→    ∃ L₀ : ℕ, ∀ l : ℕ, l ≥ L₀ →
    43→      |(ramseyR k (l + 1) : ℝ) / (ramseyR k l : ℝ) - 1| ≤ ε :=
    44→  sorry
    45→
    46→end
    47→

1→import Mathlib.Combinatorics.SimpleGraph.Basic
     2→import Mathlib.Data.Nat.Lattice
     3→import Mathlib.Data.Set.Card
     4→import Mathlib.Analysis.SpecialFunctions.Pow.Real
     5→
     6→open SimpleGraph
     7→
     8→noncomputable section
     9→
    10→/-!
    11→# Erdős Problem #546
    12→
    13→Let G be a graph with no isolated vertices and m edges. Is it true that
    14→R(G) ≤ 2^{O(m^{1/2})}?
    15→
    16→This is true, and was proved by Sudakov [Su11]. The analogous question for
    17→≥ 3 colours is still open. A more precise question is [545].
    18→-/
    19→
    20→/-- A graph H contains a copy of graph G (as a subgraph) if there is an injective
    21→    function from V(G) to V(H) that preserves adjacency. -/
    22→def ContainsSubgraphCopy {V W : Type*} (G : SimpleGraph V) (H : SimpleGraph W) : Prop :=
    23→  ∃ f : V → W, Function.Injective f ∧ ∀ u v, G.Adj u v → H.Adj (f u) (f v)
    24→
    25→/-- The diagonal Ramsey number R(G) for a graph G on Fin k: the minimum N such that
    26→    every graph H on N vertices contains a copy of G or its complement contains
    27→    a copy of G. -/
    28→noncomputable def ramseyNumber {k : ℕ} (G : SimpleGraph (Fin k)) : ℕ :=
    29→  sInf {N : ℕ | ∀ (H : SimpleGraph (Fin N)),
    30→    ContainsSubgraphCopy G H ∨ ContainsSubgraphCopy G Hᶜ}
    31→
    32→/--
    33→Erdős Problem #546 [Er84b,p.10]:
    34→
    35→Let G be a graph with no isolated vertices and m edges. Is it true that
    36→R(G) ≤ 2^{O(m^{1/2})}?
    37→
    38→Formally: there exists a constant C > 0 such that for every graph G on k
    39→vertices with no isolated vertices, R(G) ≤ 2^(C · √m) where m is the
    40→number of edges.
    41→-/
    42→theorem erdos_problem_546 :
    43→    ∃ C : ℝ, C > 0 ∧
    44→    ∀ (k : ℕ) (G : SimpleGraph (Fin k)),
    45→      (∀ v : Fin k, ∃ w : Fin k, G.Adj v w) →
    46→      (ramseyNumber G : ℝ) ≤ (2 : ℝ) ^ (C * Real.sqrt (G.edgeSet.ncard : ℝ)) :=
    47→  sorry
    48→
    49→end
    50→

1→/-
     2→Copyright (c) 2022 Yaël Dillies, Bhavik Mehta. All rights reserved.
     3→Released under Apache 2.0 license as described in the file LICENSE.
     4→Authors: Yaël Dillies, Bhavik Mehta
     5→-/
     6→module
     7→
     8→public import Mathlib.Combinatorics.SimpleGraph.Copy
     9→public import Mathlib.Combinatorics.SimpleGraph.Operations
    10→public import Mathlib.Combinatorics.SimpleGraph.Paths
    11→public import Mathlib.Data.Finset.Pairwise
    12→public import Mathlib.Data.Fintype.Pigeonhole
    13→public import Mathlib.Data.Fintype.Powerset
    14→public import Mathlib.Data.Nat.Lattice
    15→public import Mathlib.SetTheory.Cardinal.Finite
    16→
    17→/-!
    18→# Graph cliques
    19→
    20→This file defines cliques in simple graphs.
    21→A clique is a set of vertices that are pairwise adjacent.
    22→
    23→## Main declarations
    24→
    25→* `SimpleGraph.IsClique`: Predicate for a set of vertices to be a clique.
    26→* `SimpleGraph.IsNClique`: Predicate for a set of vertices to be an `n`-clique.
    27→* `SimpleGraph.cliqueFinset`: Finset of `n`-cliques of a graph.
    28→* `SimpleGraph.CliqueFree`: Predicate for a graph to have no `n`-cliques.
    29→-/
    30→
    31→@[expose] public section
    32→
    33→open Finset Fintype Function SimpleGraph.Walk
    34→
    35→namespace SimpleGraph
    36→
    37→variable {α β : Type*} (G H : SimpleGraph α)
    38→
    39→/-! ### Cliques -/
    40→
    41→
    42→section Clique
    43→
    44→variable {s t : Set α}
    45→
    46→/-- A clique in a graph is a set of vertices that are pairwise adjacent. -/
    47→abbrev IsClique (s : Set α) : Prop :=
    48→  s.Pairwise G.Adj
    49→
    50→theorem isClique_iff : G.IsClique s ↔ s.Pairwise G.Adj :=
    51→  Iff.rfl
    52→
    53→lemma not_isClique_iff : ¬ G.IsClique s ↔ ∃ (v w : s), v ≠ w ∧ ¬ G.Adj v w := by
    54→  aesop (add simp [isClique_iff, Set.Pairwise])
    55→
    56→/-- A clique is a set of vertices whose induced graph is complete. -/
    57→theorem isClique_iff_induce_eq : G.IsClique s ↔ G.induce s = ⊤ := by
    58→  rw [isClique_iff]
    59→  constructor
    60→  · intro h
    61→    ext ⟨v, hv⟩ ⟨w, hw⟩
    62→    simp only [comap_adj, top_adj, Ne, Subtype.mk_eq_mk]
    63→    exact ⟨Adj.ne, h hv hw⟩
    64→  · intro h v hv w hw hne
    65→    have h2 : (G.induce s).Adj ⟨v, hv⟩ ⟨w, hw⟩ = _ := rfl
    66→    conv_lhs at h2 => rw [h]
    67→    simp only [top_adj, ne_eq, Subtype.mk.injEq, eq_iff_iff] at h2
    68→    exact h2.1 hne
    69→
    70→theorem isClique_iff_isChain_adj : G.IsClique s ↔ IsChain G.Adj s := by
    71→  simp [IsChain, G.symm.iff]
    72→
    73→instance [DecidableEq α] [DecidableRel G.Adj] {s : Finset α} : Decidable (G.IsClique s) :=
    74→  decidable_of_iff' _ G.isClique_iff
    75→
    76→variable {G H} {a b : α}
    77→
    78→lemma isClique_empty : G.IsClique ∅ := by simp
    79→
    80→lemma isClique_singleton (a : α) : G.IsClique {a} := by simp
    81→
    82→theorem IsClique.of_subsingleton {G : SimpleGraph α} (hs : s.Subsingleton) : G.IsClique s :=
    83→  hs.pairwise G.Adj
    84→
    85→lemma isClique_pair : G.IsClique {a, b} ↔ a ≠ b → G.Adj a b := Set.pairwise_pair_of_symmetric G.symm
    86→
    87→@[simp]
    88→lemma isClique_insert : G.IsClique (insert a s) ↔ G.IsClique s ∧ ∀ b ∈ s, a ≠ b → G.Adj a b :=
    89→  Set.pairwise_insert_of_symmetric G.symm
    90→
    91→lemma isClique_insert_of_notMem (ha : a ∉ s) :
    92→    G.IsClique (insert a s) ↔ G.IsClique s ∧ ∀ b ∈ s, G.Adj a b :=
    93→  Set.pairwise_insert_of_symmetric_of_notMem G.symm ha
    94→
    95→lemma IsClique.insert (hs : G.IsClique s) (h : ∀ b ∈ s, a ≠ b → G.Adj a b) :
    96→    G.IsClique (insert a s) := hs.insert_of_symmetric G.symm h
    97→
    98→theorem IsClique.mono (h : G ≤ H) : G.IsClique s → H.IsClique s := Set.Pairwise.mono' h
    99→
   100→theorem IsClique.subset (h : t ⊆ s) : G.IsClique s → G.IsClique t := Set.Pairwise.mono h

1→import Mathlib.Combinatorics.SimpleGraph.Basic
     2→import Mathlib.Combinatorics.SimpleGraph.Clique
     3→import Mathlib.Data.Nat.Lattice
     4→import Mathlib.Data.Real.Basic
     5→
     6→open SimpleGraph
     7→
     8→noncomputable section
     9→
    10→/-!
    11→# Erdős Problem #553
    12→
    13→Let R(3,3,n) denote the smallest integer m such that if we 3-colour the edges
    14→of K_m then there is either a monochromatic triangle in one of the first two
    15→colours or a monochromatic K_n in the third colour. Define R(3,n) similarly
    16→but with two colours. Show that
    17→
    18→  R(3,3,n) / R(3,n) → ∞
    19→
    20→as n → ∞.
    21→
    22→A problem of Erdős and Sós. This was solved by Alon and Rödl [AlRo05], who
    23→showed R(3,3,n) ≍ n³(log n)^{O(1)}, recalling that Shearer [Sh83] showed
    24→R(3,n) ≪ n²/log n.
    25→-/
    26→
    27→/-- The Ramsey number R(3,n): the minimum N such that every 2-colouring of
    28→    the edges of K_N yields either a monochromatic triangle in colour 1 or
    29→    a monochromatic K_n in colour 2. Equivalently, every simple graph on N
    30→    vertices contains a 3-clique or its complement contains an n-clique. -/
    31→noncomputable def ramseyR3 (n : ℕ) : ℕ :=
    32→  sInf {N : ℕ | ∀ (G : SimpleGraph (Fin N)), ¬G.CliqueFree 3 ∨ ¬Gᶜ.CliqueFree n}
    33→
    34→/-- The Ramsey number R(3,3,n): the minimum N such that every 3-colouring of
    35→    the edges of K_N yields either a monochromatic triangle in one of the
    36→    first two colours or a monochromatic K_n in the third colour.
    37→
    38→    A 3-colouring is modelled by two edge-disjoint graphs G₁, G₂ (the first
    39→    two colour classes); the third colour class is the complement (G₁ ⊔ G₂)ᶜ. -/
    40→noncomputable def ramseyR33 (n : ℕ) : ℕ :=
    41→  sInf {N : ℕ | ∀ (G₁ G₂ : SimpleGraph (Fin N)),
    42→    Disjoint G₁ G₂ →
    43→    ¬G₁.CliqueFree 3 ∨ ¬G₂.CliqueFree 3 ∨ ¬(G₁ ⊔ G₂)ᶜ.CliqueFree n}
    44→
    45→/--
    46→Erdős Problem #553 [ErSo80]:
    47→
    48→R(3,3,n) / R(3,n) → ∞ as n → ∞.
    49→
    50→Formulated as: for every positive real C, there exists N₀ such that for all
    51→n ≥ N₀ we have R(3,3,n) ≥ C · R(3,n).
    52→-/
    53→theorem erdos_problem_553 :
    54→    ∀ C : ℝ, C > 0 →
    55→    ∃ N₀ : ℕ, ∀ n : ℕ, n ≥ N₀ →
    56→      C * (ramseyR3 n : ℝ) ≤ (ramseyR33 n : ℝ) :=
    57→  sorry
    58→
    59→end
    60→

1→import Mathlib.Combinatorics.SimpleGraph.Basic
     2→import Mathlib.Combinatorics.SimpleGraph.Clique
     3→import Mathlib.Data.Nat.Lattice
     4→import Mathlib.Data.Real.Basic
     5→
     6→open SimpleGraph
     7→
     8→noncomputable section
     9→
    10→/-!
    11→# Erdős Problem #812
    12→
    13→Is it true that R(n+1)/R(n) ≥ 1 + c for some constant c > 0, for all large n?
    14→Is it true that R(n+1) - R(n) ≫ n²?
    15→
    16→Here R(n) denotes the diagonal Ramsey number R(n,n): the minimum N such that
    17→every simple graph on N vertices contains either a clique of size n or an
    18→independent set of size n.
    19→
    20→Burr, Erdős, Faudree, and Schelp [BEFS89] proved that R(n+1) - R(n) ≥ 4n - 8
    21→for all n ≥ 2. The lower bound from Problem #165 implies that
    22→R(n+2) - R(n) ≫ n^{2-o(1)}.
    23→-/
    24→
    25→/-- The diagonal Ramsey number R(n) = R(n,n): the minimum N such that every
    26→    simple graph on N vertices contains either an n-clique or an independent
    27→    set of size n (an n-clique in the complement). -/
    28→noncomputable def diagonalRamsey (n : ℕ) : ℕ :=
    29→  sInf {N : ℕ | ∀ (G : SimpleGraph (Fin N)), ¬G.CliqueFree n ∨ ¬Gᶜ.CliqueFree n}
    30→
    31→/--
    32→**Erdős Problem #812, Part 1** [Er91]:
    33→
    34→There exists a constant c > 0 such that R(n+1)/R(n) ≥ 1 + c for all
    35→sufficiently large n. That is, the diagonal Ramsey numbers grow at least
    36→geometrically.
    37→-/
    38→theorem erdos_problem_812a :
    39→    ∃ c : ℝ, 0 < c ∧
    40→    ∃ N₀ : ℕ, ∀ n : ℕ, N₀ ≤ n →
    41→      (diagonalRamsey (n + 1) : ℝ) / (diagonalRamsey n : ℝ) ≥ 1 + c :=
    42→  sorry
    43→
    44→/--
    45→**Erdős Problem #812, Part 2** [Er91]:
    46→
    47→R(n+1) - R(n) ≫ n², i.e., there exists a constant c > 0 such that
    48→R(n+1) - R(n) ≥ c · n² for all sufficiently large n.
    49→-/
    50→theorem erdos_problem_812b :
    51→    ∃ c : ℝ, 0 < c ∧
    52→    ∃ N₀ : ℕ, ∀ n : ℕ, N₀ ≤ n →
    53→      (diagonalRamsey (n + 1) : ℝ) - (diagonalRamsey n : ℝ) ≥ c * (n : ℝ) ^ 2 :=
    54→  sorry
    55→
    56→end
    57→

100→theorem IsClique.subset (h : t ⊆ s) : G.IsClique s → G.IsClique t := Set.Pairwise.mono h

   102→@[simp]
   103→theorem isClique_bot_iff : (⊥ : SimpleGraph α).IsClique s ↔ (s : Set α).Subsingleton :=
   104→  Set.pairwise_bot_iff
   105→
   106→alias ⟨IsClique.subsingleton, _⟩ := isClique_bot_iff

   108→protected theorem IsClique.map (h : G.IsClique s) {f : α ↪ β} : (G.map f).IsClique (f '' s) := by
   109→  rintro _ ⟨a, ha, rfl⟩ _ ⟨b, hb, rfl⟩ hab
   110→  exact ⟨a, b, h ha hb <| ne_of_apply_ne _ hab, rfl, rfl⟩
   111→
   112→theorem isClique_map_iff_of_nontrivial {f : α ↪ β} {t : Set β} (ht : t.Nontrivial) :
   113→    (G.map f).IsClique t ↔ ∃ (s : Set α), G.IsClique s ∧ f '' s = t := by
   114→  refine ⟨fun h ↦ ⟨f ⁻¹' t, ?_, ?_⟩, by rintro ⟨x, hs, rfl⟩; exact hs.map⟩
   115→  · rintro x (hx : f x ∈ t) y (hy : f y ∈ t) hne
   116→    obtain ⟨u, v, huv, hux, hvy⟩ := h hx hy (by simpa)
   117→    rw [EmbeddingLike.apply_eq_iff_eq] at hux hvy
   118→    rwa [← hux, ← hvy]
   119→  rw [Set.image_preimage_eq_iff]
   120→  intro x hxt
   121→  obtain ⟨y, hyt, hyne⟩ := ht.exists_ne x
   122→  obtain ⟨u, v, -, rfl, rfl⟩ := h hyt hxt hyne
   123→  exact Set.mem_range_self _
   124→
   125→theorem isClique_map_iff {f : α ↪ β} {t : Set β} :
   126→    (G.map f).IsClique t ↔ t.Subsingleton ∨ ∃ (s : Set α), G.IsClique s ∧ f '' s = t := by
   127→  obtain (ht | ht) := t.subsingleton_or_nontrivial
   128→  · simp [IsClique.of_subsingleton, ht]
   129→  simp [isClique_map_iff_of_nontrivial ht, ht.not_subsingleton]
   130→
   131→@[simp] theorem isClique_map_image_iff {f : α ↪ β} :
   132→    (G.map f).IsClique (f '' s) ↔ G.IsClique s := by
   133→  rw [isClique_map_iff, f.injective.subsingleton_image_iff]
   134→  obtain (hs | hs) := s.subsingleton_or_nontrivial
   135→  · simp [hs, IsClique.of_subsingleton]
   136→  simp [or_iff_right hs.not_subsingleton, Set.image_eq_image f.injective]
   137→
   138→variable {f : α ↪ β} {t : Finset β}
   139→
   140→theorem isClique_map_finset_iff_of_nontrivial (ht : t.Nontrivial) :
   141→    (G.map f).IsClique t ↔ ∃ (s : Finset α), G.IsClique s ∧ s.map f = t := by
   142→  constructor
   143→  · rw [isClique_map_iff_of_nontrivial (by simpa)]
   144→    rintro ⟨s, hs, hst⟩
   145→    obtain ⟨s, rfl⟩ := Set.Finite.exists_finset_coe <|
   146→      (show s.Finite from Set.Finite.of_finite_image (by simp [hst]) f.injective.injOn)
   147→    exact ⟨s,hs, Finset.coe_inj.1 (by simpa)⟩
   148→  rintro ⟨s, hs, rfl⟩
   149→  simpa using hs.map (f := f)
   150→
   151→theorem isClique_map_finset_iff :
   152→    (G.map f).IsClique t ↔ #t ≤ 1 ∨ ∃ (s : Finset α), G.IsClique s ∧ s.map f = t := by
   153→  obtain (ht | ht) := le_or_gt #t 1
   154→  · simp only [ht, true_or, iff_true]
   155→    exact IsClique.of_subsingleton <| card_le_one.1 ht
   156→  rw [isClique_map_finset_iff_of_nontrivial, ← not_lt]
   157→  · simp [ht]
   158→  exact Finset.one_lt_card_iff_nontrivial.mp ht

   160→protected theorem IsClique.finsetMap {f : α ↪ β} {s : Finset α} (h : G.IsClique s) :
   161→    (G.map f).IsClique (s.map f) := by
   162→  simpa

   164→/-- If a set of vertices `A` is a clique in subgraph of `G` induced by a superset of `A`,
   165→its embedding is a clique in `G`. -/
   166→theorem IsClique.of_induce {S : Subgraph G} {F : Set α} {A : Set F}
   167→    (c : (S.induce F).coe.IsClique A) : G.IsClique (Subtype.val '' A) := by
   168→  simp only [Set.Pairwise, Set.mem_image, Subtype.exists, exists_and_right, exists_eq_right]
   169→  intro _ ⟨_, ainA⟩ _ ⟨_, binA⟩ anb
   170→  exact S.adj_sub (c ainA binA (Subtype.coe_ne_coe.mp anb)).2.2
   171→
   172→lemma IsClique.sdiff_of_sup_edge {v w : α} {s : Set α} (hc : (G ⊔ edge v w).IsClique s) :
   173→    G.IsClique (s \ {v}) := by
   174→  intro _ hx _ hy hxy
   175→  have := hc hx.1 hy.1 hxy
   176→  simp_all [sup_adj, edge_adj]
   177→
   178→lemma isClique_sup_edge_of_ne_sdiff {v w : α} {s : Set α} (h : v ≠ w) (hv : G.IsClique (s \ {v}))
   179→    (hw : G.IsClique (s \ {w})) : (G ⊔ edge v w).IsClique s := by
   180→  intro x hx y hy hxy
   181→  by_cases h' : x ∈ s \ {v} ∧ y ∈ s \ {v} ∨ x ∈ s \ {w} ∧ y ∈ s \ {w}
   182→  · obtain (⟨hx, hy⟩ | ⟨hx, hy⟩) := h'
   183→    · exact hv.mono le_sup_left hx hy hxy
   184→    · exact hw.mono le_sup_left hx hy hxy
   185→  · exact Or.inr ⟨by by_cases x = v <;> aesop, hxy⟩
   186→
   187→lemma isClique_sup_edge_of_ne_iff {v w : α} {s : Set α} (h : v ≠ w) :
   188→    (G ⊔ edge v w).IsClique s ↔ G.IsClique (s \ {v}) ∧ G.IsClique (s \ {w}) :=
   189→  ⟨fun h' ↦ ⟨h'.sdiff_of_sup_edge, (edge_comm .. ▸ h').sdiff_of_sup_edge⟩,
   190→    fun h' ↦ isClique_sup_edge_of_ne_sdiff h h'.1 h'.2⟩

   193→theorem isClique_range_copy_top (f : Copy (⊤ : SimpleGraph β) G) :
   194→    G.IsClique (Set.range f) := by
   195→  intro _ ⟨_, h⟩ _ ⟨_, h'⟩ nh
   196→  rw [← h, ← Copy.topEmbedding_apply, ← h', ← Copy.topEmbedding_apply] at nh ⊢
   197→  rwa [← f.topEmbedding.coe_toEmbedding, (f.topEmbedding.apply_eq_iff_eq _ _).ne,
   198→    ← top_adj, ← f.topEmbedding.map_adj_iff] at nh

200→end Clique
   201→
   202→/-! ### `n`-cliques -/
   203→
   204→
   205→section NClique
   206→
   207→variable {n : ℕ} {s : Finset α}
   208→
   209→/-- An `n`-clique in a graph is a set of `n` vertices which are pairwise connected. -/
   210→structure IsNClique (n : ℕ) (s : Finset α) : Prop where
   211→  isClique : G.IsClique s
   212→  card_eq : #s = n
   213→
   214→theorem isNClique_iff : G.IsNClique n s ↔ G.IsClique s ∧ #s = n :=
   215→  ⟨fun h ↦ ⟨h.1, h.2⟩, fun h ↦ ⟨h.1, h.2⟩⟩
   216→
   217→instance [DecidableEq α] [DecidableRel G.Adj] {n : ℕ} {s : Finset α} :
   218→    Decidable (G.IsNClique n s) :=
   219→  decidable_of_iff' _ G.isNClique_iff
   220→
   221→variable {G H} {a b c : α}
   222→
   223→@[simp] lemma isNClique_empty : G.IsNClique n ∅ ↔ n = 0 := by simp [isNClique_iff, eq_comm]
   224→
   225→@[simp]
   226→lemma isNClique_singleton : G.IsNClique n {a} ↔ n = 1 := by simp [isNClique_iff, eq_comm]
   227→
   228→theorem IsNClique.mono (h : G ≤ H) : G.IsNClique n s → H.IsNClique n s := by
   229→  simp_rw [isNClique_iff]
   230→  exact And.imp_left (IsClique.mono h)
   231→
   232→protected theorem IsNClique.map (h : G.IsNClique n s) {f : α ↪ β} :
   233→    (G.map f).IsNClique n (s.map f) :=
   234→  ⟨by rw [coe_map]; exact h.1.map, (card_map _).trans h.2⟩
   235→
   236→theorem isNClique_map_iff (hn : 1 < n) {t : Finset β} {f : α ↪ β} :
   237→    (G.map f).IsNClique n t ↔ ∃ s : Finset α, G.IsNClique n s ∧ s.map f = t := by
   238→  rw [isNClique_iff, isClique_map_finset_iff, or_and_right,
   239→    or_iff_right (by rintro ⟨h', rfl⟩; exact h'.not_gt hn)]
   240→  constructor
   241→  · rintro ⟨⟨s, hs, rfl⟩, rfl⟩
   242→    simp [isNClique_iff, hs]
   243→  rintro ⟨s, hs, rfl⟩
   244→  simp [hs.card_eq, hs.isClique]
   245→
   246→@[simp]
   247→theorem isNClique_bot_iff : (⊥ : SimpleGraph α).IsNClique n s ↔ n ≤ 1 ∧ #s = n := by
   248→  rw [isNClique_iff, isClique_bot_iff]
   249→  refine and_congr_left ?_
   250→  rintro rfl
   251→  exact card_le_one.symm
   252→
   253→@[simp]
   254→theorem isNClique_zero : G.IsNClique 0 s ↔ s = ∅ := by
   255→  simp only [isNClique_iff, Finset.card_eq_zero, and_iff_right_iff_imp]; rintro rfl; simp
   256→
   257→@[simp]
   258→theorem isNClique_one : G.IsNClique 1 s ↔ ∃ a, s = {a} := by
   259→  simp only [isNClique_iff, card_eq_one, and_iff_right_iff_imp]; rintro ⟨a, rfl⟩; simp
   260→
   261→section DecidableEq
   262→
   263→variable [DecidableEq α]
   264→
   265→protected theorem IsNClique.insert (hs : G.IsNClique n s) (h : ∀ b ∈ s, G.Adj a b) :
   266→    G.IsNClique (n + 1) (insert a s) := by
   267→  constructor
   268→  · push_cast
   269→    exact hs.1.insert fun b hb _ => h _ hb
   270→  · rw [card_insert_of_notMem fun ha => (h _ ha).ne rfl, hs.2]
   271→
   272→lemma IsNClique.erase_of_mem (hs : G.IsNClique n s) (ha : a ∈ s) :
   273→    G.IsNClique (n - 1) (s.erase a) where
   274→  isClique := hs.isClique.subset <| by simp
   275→  card_eq := by rw [card_erase_of_mem ha, hs.2]
   276→
   277→protected lemma IsNClique.insert_erase
   278→    (hs : G.IsNClique n s) (ha : ∀ w ∈ s \ {b}, G.Adj a w) (hb : b ∈ s) :
   279→    G.IsNClique n (insert a (erase s b)) := by
   280→  cases n with
   281→  | zero => exact False.elim <| notMem_empty _ (isNClique_zero.1 hs ▸ hb)
   282→  | succ _ => exact (hs.erase_of_mem hb).insert fun w h ↦ by aesop
   283→
   284→theorem is3Clique_triple_iff : G.IsNClique 3 {a, b, c} ↔ G.Adj a b ∧ G.Adj a c ∧ G.Adj b c := by
   285→  simp only [isNClique_iff, Set.pairwise_insert_of_symmetric G.symm, coe_insert]
   286→  by_cases hab : a = b <;> by_cases hbc : b = c <;> by_cases hac : a = c <;> subst_vars <;>
   287→    simp [and_rotate, *]
   288→
   289→theorem is3Clique_iff :
   290→    G.IsNClique 3 s ↔ ∃ a b c, G.Adj a b ∧ G.Adj a c ∧ G.Adj b c ∧ s = {a, b, c} := by
   291→  refine ⟨fun h ↦ ?_, ?_⟩
   292→  · obtain ⟨a, b, c, -, -, -, hs⟩ := card_eq_three.1 h.card_eq
   293→    refine ⟨a, b, c, ?_⟩
   294→    rwa [hs, eq_self_iff_true, and_true, is3Clique_triple_iff.symm, ← hs]
   295→  · rintro ⟨a, b, c, hab, hbc, hca, rfl⟩
   296→    exact is3Clique_triple_iff.2 ⟨hab, hbc, hca⟩
   297→
   298→end DecidableEq
   299→

300→theorem is3Clique_iff_exists_cycle_length_three :
   301→    (∃ s : Finset α, G.IsNClique 3 s) ↔ ∃ (u : α) (w : G.Walk u u), w.IsCycle ∧ w.length = 3 := by
   302→  classical
   303→  simp_rw [is3Clique_iff, isCycle_def]
   304→  exact
   305→    ⟨(fun ⟨_, a, _, _, hab, hac, hbc, _⟩ => ⟨a, cons hab (cons hbc (cons hac.symm nil)), by aesop⟩),
   306→    (fun ⟨_, .cons hab (.cons hbc (.cons hca nil)), _, _⟩ => ⟨_, _, _, _, hab, hca.symm, hbc, rfl⟩)⟩
   307→
   308→/-- If a set of vertices `A` is an `n`-clique in subgraph of `G` induced by a superset of `A`,
   309→its embedding is an `n`-clique in `G`. -/
   310→theorem IsNClique.of_induce {S : Subgraph G} {F : Set α} {s : Finset { x // x ∈ F }} {n : ℕ}
   311→    (cc : (S.induce F).coe.IsNClique n s) :
   312→    G.IsNClique n (Finset.map ⟨Subtype.val, Subtype.val_injective⟩ s) := by
   313→  rw [isNClique_iff] at cc ⊢
   314→  simp only [coe_map, card_map]
   315→  exact ⟨cc.left.of_induce, cc.right⟩
   316→
   317→set_option linter.style.whitespace false in -- manual alignment is not recognised
   318→lemma IsNClique.erase_of_sup_edge_of_mem [DecidableEq α] {v w : α} {s : Finset α} {n : ℕ}
   319→    (hc : (G ⊔ edge v w).IsNClique n s) (hx : v ∈ s) : G.IsNClique (n - 1) (s.erase v) where
   320→  isClique := coe_erase v _ ▸ hc.1.sdiff_of_sup_edge
   321→  card_eq  := by rw [card_erase_of_mem hx, hc.2]
   322→
   323→/-- The vertices in a copy of `⊤ : SimpleGraph β` are a `card β`-clique. -/
   324→theorem isNClique_map_copy_top [Fintype β] (f : Copy (⊤ : SimpleGraph β) G) :
   325→    G.IsNClique (card β) (univ.map f.toEmbedding) := by
   326→  rw [isNClique_iff, card_map, card_univ, coe_map, coe_univ, Set.image_univ]
   327→  exact ⟨isClique_range_copy_top f, rfl⟩
   328→
   329→end NClique
   330→
   331→/-! ### Graphs without cliques -/
   332→
   333→
   334→section CliqueFree
   335→
   336→variable {m n : ℕ}
   337→
   338→/-- `G.CliqueFree n` means that `G` has no `n`-cliques. -/
   339→def CliqueFree (n : ℕ) : Prop :=
   340→  ∀ t, ¬G.IsNClique n t
   341→
   342→variable {G H} {s : Finset α}
   343→
   344→theorem IsNClique.not_cliqueFree (hG : G.IsNClique n s) : ¬G.CliqueFree n :=
   345→  fun h ↦ h _ hG
   346→
   347→theorem not_cliqueFree_of_top_embedding {n : ℕ} (f : (⊤ : SimpleGraph (Fin n)) ↪g G) :
   348→    ¬G.CliqueFree n := by
   349→  simp only [CliqueFree, isNClique_iff, isClique_iff_induce_eq, not_forall, Classical.not_not]
   350→  use Finset.univ.map f.toEmbedding
   351→  simp only [card_map, Finset.card_fin, and_true]
   352→  ext ⟨v, hv⟩ ⟨w, hw⟩
   353→  simp only [coe_map, Set.mem_image, coe_univ, Set.mem_univ, true_and] at hv hw
   354→  obtain ⟨v', rfl⟩ := hv
   355→  obtain ⟨w', rfl⟩ := hw
   356→  simp_rw [RelEmbedding.coe_toEmbedding, comap_adj, Function.Embedding.coe_subtype, f.map_adj_iff,
   357→    top_adj, ne_eq, Subtype.mk.injEq, RelEmbedding.inj]
   358→
   359→/-- An embedding of a complete graph that witnesses the fact that the graph is not clique-free. -/
   360→noncomputable def topEmbeddingOfNotCliqueFree {n : ℕ} (h : ¬G.CliqueFree n) :
   361→    (⊤ : SimpleGraph (Fin n)) ↪g G := by
   362→  simp only [CliqueFree, isNClique_iff, isClique_iff_induce_eq, not_forall, Classical.not_not] at h
   363→  obtain ⟨ha, hb⟩ := h.choose_spec
   364→  have : (⊤ : SimpleGraph (Fin #h.choose)) ≃g (⊤ : SimpleGraph h.choose) := by
   365→    apply Iso.completeGraph
   366→    simpa using (Fintype.equivFin h.choose).symm
   367→  rw [← ha] at this
   368→  convert (Embedding.induce ↑h.choose).comp this.toEmbedding
   369→  exact hb.symm
   370→
   371→theorem not_cliqueFree_iff (n : ℕ) : ¬G.CliqueFree n ↔ Nonempty (completeGraph (Fin n) ↪g G) :=
   372→  ⟨fun h ↦ ⟨topEmbeddingOfNotCliqueFree h⟩, fun ⟨f⟩ ↦ not_cliqueFree_of_top_embedding f⟩
   373→
   374→theorem cliqueFree_iff {n : ℕ} : G.CliqueFree n ↔ IsEmpty (completeGraph (Fin n) ↪g G) := by
   375→  contrapose!; exact not_cliqueFree_iff n
   376→
   377→/-- A simple graph has no `card β`-cliques iff it does not contain `⊤ : SimpleGraph β`. -/
   378→theorem cliqueFree_iff_top_free {β : Type*} [Fintype β] :
   379→    G.CliqueFree (card β) ↔ (⊤ : SimpleGraph β).Free G := by
   380→  rw [← not_iff_not, not_free, not_cliqueFree_iff,
   381→    isContained_congr (Iso.completeGraph (equivFin β)) Iso.refl]
   382→  exact ⟨fun ⟨f⟩ ↦ ⟨f.toCopy⟩, fun ⟨f⟩ ↦ ⟨f.topEmbedding⟩⟩
   383→
   384→theorem not_cliqueFree_card_of_top_embedding [Fintype α] (f : (⊤ : SimpleGraph α) ↪g G) :
   385→    ¬G.CliqueFree (card α) := by
   386→  rw [not_cliqueFree_iff]
   387→  exact ⟨(Iso.completeGraph (equivFin α)).symm.toEmbedding.trans f⟩
   388→
   389→@[simp] lemma not_cliqueFree_zero : ¬ G.CliqueFree 0 :=
   390→  fun h ↦ h ∅ <| isNClique_empty.mpr rfl
   391→
   392→@[simp]
   393→theorem cliqueFree_bot (h : 2 ≤ n) : (⊥ : SimpleGraph α).CliqueFree n := by
   394→  intro t ht
   395→  have := le_trans h (isNClique_bot_iff.1 ht).1
   396→  contradiction
   397→
   398→theorem CliqueFree.mono (h : m ≤ n) : G.CliqueFree m → G.CliqueFree n := by
   399→  intro hG s hs
